metadata.title: Journal Pre-proof Report of 5 nurses infecting COVID-19 during patient care: case Series Report of 5 nurses infecting COVID-19 during patient care: Case Series

affiliation.laboratory: -MSC of Medical Surgical Nursing, Clinical Research Development Unit, Shahid Mostafa Khomeini Hospital

body_text.text: COVID-19 has recently become pandemic all over the world. It has a high number of victims and their number is increasing rapidly. Transmission from person to person occurs primarily through direct or indirect contact through droplets spread by coughing or sneezing from an infected patients (1) . Therfore it seems that the prevention is the best possible way.

So people should follow the safety and health tips, including no rubbing, not touching objects, washing hands regularly, using a mask, keeping a distance from people at risk and reducing travel to crowded areas (1, 2) .

Diagnosis can be made using clinical signs obtained through the history of this information and blood tests, as well as CT scans, chest photographs and real-time PCR as a gold standard (3, 4) . The mortality rate of this disease is various from 10% to 35% in different populations (5, 6) . About two months after the onset of COVID-19, more than 82,000 cases have been diagnosed and more than 2,800 deaths have been reported, most of them were in China (7).

To date (4/14/2020) the statistics showed that about two milions of people are affected and more than 120.000 death of COVID-19 have been reported all over the world (https://www.worldometers.info/coronavirus/). Nurses in the hospitalls are more at risk than other people in the community because they are exposed to direct contact with these patients. Nurses are the largest group of clinical and care providers for patients admitted to hospitals, as they are responsible for the care and recovery of patients, so they have to follow safety and health tips at work.The present study looked at five nurses who contracted COVID-19 during patient care.

From February to April 2020 in the Mostafa Khomini Hospital (164 bed), 463 patiens with COVID-19 were reported and 125 nurse were involved in this center as their duty shift of 24h at work and 72h off. All of nurses were equipped with eye protection, masks, fase shield, gloves and shoe covers. Standard sterile protocols were performed for all cases. All nurses were in similar expouser level and similar protection. But, despite all of protections, five of them were infected with this viruse (4%). Infected nurses were in 33-39 years old (They were first positive for real-time PCR (TaKaRa, Japan) and their CT scan was performed after realtime PCR test (Fig. 1) . None of them were hospitalized. They preferred to be isolated at home and receive the necessary care and treatment. Their medication was Oseltamivir, Azithromycin and Kaletra However other serology methods were useful for confirm and follow up of patients (8) This study reported that receiving the necessary care and treatment at home was successfully performed. Due to the higher incidence of COVID-19 this experience might be useful in some cases in the future.

The present study had several limitations, the number of samples was very small, but due to high importance of this subject and successfulness of self medication of neursess as well as their quarantineation at home, researchers have made it as an interesting goal. We also could not obtain the results of clinical trials and their course of the disease.
Given that nurses are affected, it can be concluded that everyone in the community is at risk for the COVID-19 infection and prevention is the main strategy against this disease.

FIGREF0.text: The HRCT of patients, A,B, C, and D were normal lung HRCT but E and F that both related to one patients have small air space consolidation with faint peripheral ground glass infiltrates in posterobasal segment of the Right lower lobe.DiscussionNurses' exposure to SARS-CoV-2 is one of the most important issues because of the following reasons. First, the COVID-19 easily spreads among all people that facing with patients. The second, direct contact with infected people can easily transmit the disease.Third, despite enough skill knowledge of nurses in their exposures to infected patients, they can be affected very quickly. Because at the the beginning of SARS-CoV-2 infection in Iran, there were no enough protection against this infection. In this case, staff of this hospital managed patients with COVID-19 similar with rotine infections. The fourth point of this study is COVID-19 can affect all people, whether those who observe the safety points incompletely or those who do not observe at all. The fifth point is COVID-19 can affect the whole age group of the society.Our results of the CT scan showed that their lungs were incompletely involved.Their lung tissue was partially destroyed, however, Nanshan Chen et al showed that there was an extensive conflict at the level of the lungs of patients with COVID-19. On the other hand, there was a conflict between the results of this study, because one out of five patients has abnormal HRCT but all of them have positive for the real-time PCR. Therefore in this study, the real-time PCR was better in the diagnosis of COVID-19 infection. As confirmed in previous finding the real-time PCR is accepted as a standard method of COVID-19 diagnosis.
